name: Titanium.UI.iOS.FeedbackGenerator
summary: The feedback generator API is introduced in iOS 10 to handle the haptic feedback when using an iPhone 7 or later devices.

methods.name: impactOccurred
methods.summary: Used to trigger a haptic feedback after an impact occurred.
methods.description: Note that this method can only be used if the feeback generator type is set to FEEDBACK_GENERATOR_TYPE_IMPACT.

methods.name: notificationOccurred
methods.summary: Used to trigger a haptic feedback after a notification has been received.
methods.description: Note that this method can only be used if the feeback generator type is set to FEEDBACK_GENERATOR_TYPE_NOTIFICATION. The single argument provided is one of the

parameters.name: notificationType
parameters.summary: The type of the notification to manage the peculiarity of the haptic feedback. If this parameter is not specified, an error will be thrown.

methods.name: prepare
methods.summary: Used to prepare the haptic sensor for the upcoming interaction with it.
methods.description: Apple recommends to use this method before calling one of the selectionChanged, impactOccurred or notificationOccurred methods to reduce a possible latency.

methods.name: selectionChanged
methods.summary: Used to trigger a haptic feedback after a selection has been made.
methods.description: Note that this method can only be used if the feeback generator type is set to FEEDBACK_GENERATOR_TYPE_SELECTION.

properties.name: style
properties.summary: The style of the feedback generator you want to create. This property is only required when using FEEDBACK_GENERATOR_TYPE_IMPACT.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: The type of feedback generator you want to create.
